result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael D Hilton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: To be paid monthly through probation.  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Pay the costs of supervision.
Must seek and maintain employment which is satisfactory to your probation agent.  Defendant  must not leave or change employment without prior approval of your probation agent.

Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly licensed and insured.

Defendant to obtain valid driver's license.

May apply for expungement if he successfully completes all conditions of probation, has no further crimes charged, and has satisfied all of the court ordered financial obligations, including payment in full the the restitution.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

Credit for 7 days if revoked.

supervisions.notes: A civil judgment has been entered against you for the unpaid court ordered financial obligations.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Defendant appears in custody from Jackson County Jail with counsel SPD Travis Satorius present.  DA Fox appears for the State.  16CM1 - victim issues regarding restitution and they were notified properly.  No corrections or changes noted to revocation packet.  DA Fox recommends 9 months on 16CM1; and 16CM57 - agrees with agent on his recommendation but should run consecutive with 16CM1.  Defense counsel Satorius requests the Court accept the agent's recommendations.  Defendant does not excercise his right to allocution.  Court orders on 16CM1 - 9 months jail; 16CM57 - Ct 1, & Ct 2 -  120 days, concurrent to each other and to 16CM1.  Civil judgment entered for costs for both cases and restitution.  79 days sentence credit on both cases.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: sent ROAW to Judge Becker.  JMM
Sentencing hearing on revocation on February 10, 2017 at 04:00 pm.

of JOC.  RTS.  No Mail Receptacle.  UTF
DNA submission form

DA Gerald Fox appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in person, in custody, with Attorney Fredrickson.  Plead guilty to Counts 1 and 3 in 16CM57.  Plead guilty to the sole count in 16CM1.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation.  Court recited the charges and possible penalties on the count he is pleading to.  Defendant understood.  Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant.  Defendant understood.  Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the pleas.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently entered his pleas and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the pleas.  Found guilty of counts 1 and 3 in 16CM57 and the sole count in 16CM1  Count 2 in 16CM57 is dismissed, but read in for sentencing purposes.  Joint recommendation for 1 year probation. Concurrent.    Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly licensed and insured.  May apply for expungement if he successfully completes probation, and has satisfied all of the court ordered financial obligations including the restitution.   $1500 restitution.  Court ordered:  sentence withheld, 1 year probation, concurrent.  Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle on the highways until properly licensed and insured.  May apply for expungement if he successfully completes all conditions of probation, has no further crimes charged, and has satisfied all of the court ordered financial obligations, including the restitution.   $1,500 restitution, plus surcharges.  Pay through probation on a monthly basis.   Obtain and maintain employment.  Not to terminate without agent's prior approval.    The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.  Obtain valid driver's license.  CC, DNA surcharge and supervision.  Submit DNA sample.  Credit for 7 days 16CM1 and  4 days credit in 16CM57.
